IMO we should not allow creating packages in non Java projects. Otherwise we 
will end up having problems that people complain about not "functioning" Java 
projects.

By design we allow all wizards also on projects/folders not on the classpath.
The wizard only shows a warning.

I also came to the conclusion that it would be in deed better to not allow the
Java wizards on non-Java projects. Especially for the new type wizards it makes
not much sense to let them run on Non=Java projects as all checks and
functionality asks for a build path (validation of supertypes, creating
inherited methods ect). 

relased changes > 20030228

Verified fix in RC3

I think disabling the menu item completely would be preferable to disabling the
wizard finish button, but in any case the error can no longer occur.

 On every key press in the new package wizard, it dumps an error to the log file.

Dirk, we should discuss if we want to fix this.
It's another related issue of the JavaModelException throws on
'getOutputLocation' on non-Java projects.

In my opinion the bug is not a 'stop ship'. It fills the log, but no harm done
otherwise.

Note that this only happens when you try to create a package for a simple 
project. So I opt to not fix.

After the first key stroke you see an error message telling that the folder 
isn't a Java project and that no packages can be added. Additionally the 
Finish button is disabled. Bad is that on every keystroke we generated a log 
entry.

Given all this it is not a stop ship for 2.1
